thread.title: Separate shootings injure 2 including boy, 16 - Chicago Tribune
thread.title_full: Separate shootings injure 2 including boy, 16 - Chicago Tribune

author: Chicago Tribune staff
title: Separate shootings injure 2 including boy, 16 - Chicago Tribune
text:
A 16-year-old boy and a man were injured in separate shootings on the Far South Side and West Side on Monday, Chicago police said.
In the latest shooting, a 32-year-old man was shot on the 200 block of North Kenneth Avenue in the West Garfield Park neighborhood, said Officer Thomas Sweeney, a Chicago police spokesman.
The shooting happened at 4:17 p.m. and left the man with a gunshot wound to his leg. He was taken to Stroger Hospital, where his condition had stabilized, Sweeney said.
The teen was shot at 10:37 a.m. on the 11900 block of South Wentworth Avenue on the Far South Side, Sweeney said.
The teen was shot in the leg but refused medical attention, according to preliminary information, Sweeney said.
Police said the boy, who is a known gang member, was not being cooperative with the investigation.
